result.execSummary:
The defendant Orville A. Lippens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

13CF981: Ct. 1 (OWI 4th w/in 5 years-Repeater)>> 6 years WSPS - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. To run concurrent to all other sentences. COURT Finds 5 days credit, concurrent. Not eligible for ERP. Eligible for SAP. Restitution if Ordered. All recommended programming as recommended, Absolute sobriety, No Contact with L.L. unless approved, No weapons of any kind. Court Costs.

14CF126: 
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Repeater-DA Repeater-DA-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> 11.5 years WSPS - 6.5 years IC and 5 years ES. To run concurrent to all other sentences. COURT Finds 471 days credit, concurrent. Not eligible for ERP. Eligible for SAP. Court Costs. Restitution if Ordered. All recommended programming as recommended, Absolute sobriety, No Contact with L.L. unless approved, No weapons of any kind. Court Costs.

Ct. 3 (Intentionally Point Firearm at Person-Repeater-DA-DA Repeater)>> 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC and 1 year ES. To run concurrent to all other sentences. COURT Finds 471 days credit, concurrent. Not eligible for ERP. Eligible for SAP. Court Costs. Restitution if Ordered. All recommended programming as recommended, Absolute sobriety, No Contact with L.L. unless approved, No weapons of any kind. Court Costs.

Ct. 6 (BJ Felony-Repeater-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> 6 years WSPS - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. To run concurrent to all other sentences. COURT Finds 471 days credit, concurrent. Not eligible for ERP.Eligible for SAP. Court Costs. Restitution if Ordered. All recommended programming as recommended, Absolute sobriety, No Contact with L.L. unless approved, No weapons of any kind. Court Costs.

Case called: 4:00pm. INCLUDES 13CF981, 13CM1866, 13TR8114, 14CF126. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA's Lesli Pluster & Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Jack Bliss. Matter set for Motion Hearing - Parties have agreement. Crt addresses NGI plea of Defendant. Atty Bliss withdraws NGI plea.  State indicates Information has not been filed in 13CF891 w/in 30 days and files Information today. Atty Bliss stipulates to filing of Information in 13CF891. State moves the court and files Amended Information 14CF126-crt grants. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (OAR) & ct 3 (bj/repeater) 13CF981- crt grants. State moves to DRI 13CM1866-crt grants. Crt finds refusal lawful in 13TR8114 and dismisses 13TR8114. State moves to DRI amend ct 2 (poss firearm by felon/repeater); amend ct 4 (threats to injure/repeater/domestic repeater/use of dangerous weapon/domestic); amend ct 5 (felony dc/domestic repeater; domestic abuse; use of dangerous weapon/repeater); ct 7 (bj/felony/repeater/use of dangerous weapon) 14CF126 - crt grants. 
PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (OWI- 4th) 13CF981; amend ct 1 (2nd deg reckless endangering/domestic abuse repeater/repeater/use of dangerous weapon/domestic abuse); amend ct 3 (felony pointing a firearm at another/domestic abuse/domestic abuse repeater/repeater); ct 6 (bj/felony/repeater/use of dangerous weapon) 14CF126. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  COURT ORDERS PSI. State to Cap Prison at 20 yrs; Initial Confinement 12 yrs; Extended Supervision 8 yrs. State free to argue eligibility of programming
Crt informs and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. DATES: Sentencing - 4/8/14 @ 1:30pm. Adjourned: 4:21pm.
